meanings.definition: Surrounding or closing off on all sides.
meanings.sent1: The enclosing walls made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent2: The enclosing darkness of the night made it hard to see.
meanings.sent3: The enclosing blanket wrapped snugly around the child.
meanings.sent4: The enclosing fog seemed to swallow the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The enclosing forest was filled with mysterious sounds.

meanings.definition: To include or contain something within.
meanings.sent1: She was enclosing a surprise gift in the box.
meanings.sent2: The letter was enclosing important documents.
meanings.sent3: He joked about enclosing a tiny elephant in his pocket.
meanings.sent4: The garden was enclosing a world of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The book was enclosing a thrilling adventure within its pages.
